text: Anders Askevold (25 December 1834 – 22 October 1900) was a Norwegian painter, best known for his landscapes and animal paintings.Anders Monsen Askevold(Store norske leksikon) ==Biography== Anders Monsen Askevold was born in Askvoll, in Sunnfjord, Norway. He was the second oldest of ten siblings. His father was a teacher. His early training started at the age of thirteen in Bergen under landscape painter Hans Leganger Reuch (1800-1854) . He was educated as a painter in Düsseldorf, but continued his studies in Paris and Munich. Askevold came to Düsseldorf in 1855 and stayed for 3 years. He trained in Düsseldorf under Hans Gude from 1855 until 1859. Askevold did some commissions for several altarpieces in Norway including the Askvoll church in 1859. Anders Askevold/utdypning (Store norske leksikon) He was known as a member of the Düsseldorf school of painting with others like Adelsteen Normann. From 1861 to 1866 he was in Paris. In 1866 Askevold moved back to Norway and settled in Bergen. After this he moved back to Düsseldorf where he would spend his winters in Germany and his summers in Norway.Figures and Cattle by a Forest Stream, artoftheprint.com, accessed April 2010 His paintings were shown at numerous international exhibitions, including world exhibitions in London (1862), Paris (1867) and (1878), Vienna (1873) and Philadelphia (1876). In Vienna and Philadelphia, he was honored with medals. In 1884, in London he won the gold medal.Anders Askevold - Dyremaler, Maler (Norsk biografisk leksikon. Forfatter av denne artikkelen, Ingrid Reed Thomsen) Askevold died in 1900 in Düsseldorf. A monument was erected in his honor by the municipality of Askvoll during 1934. Both the National Museum of Art, Architecture and Design in Oslo and Bergen Billedgalleri have notable collections of his art. A painting by Askevold sold for over £5,000 in 2009.Lot 101 Sale 2801, Christies.com, 2009, accessed April 2010 ==Gallery== File:Anders Askvold-Norsk fjordlandskap.jpg| Norwegian Fjord Landscape (probably 1889) File:Anders Askevold-Bakka i Nærøyfjorden.jpg|Bakka at Nærøyfjord (1892) File:Anders Askevold-Landskap med innsjø 1853.jpg|Landscape with Lake (1853) File:CowsbyAskevold.JPG|Scene with Cows (before 1900) ==References== ==Other sources== *Malmanger, Magne (1988) One Hundred Years of Norwegian Painting' (Nasjonalgalleriet) ==External links== *Bukowski Auktioner AB Category:1834 births Category:1900 deaths Category:19th-century Norwegian painters Category:19th-century male artists Category:Animal artists Category:Norwegian landscape painters Category:Norwegian expatriates in Germany Category:Düsseldorf school of painting Category:Norwegian male painters Category:People from Askvoll
